findings.title: Unprotected approve function
findings.description: The approve function allows unlimited spending of tokens without proper validation, leading to potential token loss.

findings.title: Unprotected transfer function
findings.description: The 'transfer' function is unprotected and can be exploited by malicious users.

findings.title: Unprotected transferFrom function
findings.description: The transferFrom function allows a spender to withdraw a set number of tokens from a specified account without proper validation or access control.

findings.title: Unprotected mint function
findings.description: The mint function is unprotected, allowing unauthorized users to create new tokens.

findings.title: Unprotected burn function
findings.description: The burn function is unprotected, allowing unauthorized access and potential manipulation of the contract's state.

findings.title: Unprotected swap function
findings.description: The swap function is unprotected, allowing unauthorized access and potential manipulation of token balances.

findings.title: Unprotected skim function
findings.description: The skim function is unprotected, allowing unauthorized access and potential exploitation.

findings.title: Unprotected sync function
findings.description: The sync function is unprotected, which can lead to potential security risks.

findings.title: Unprotected initialize function
findings.description: The initialize function is unprotected, allowing anyone to call it and potentially leading to unintended behavior.

findings.title: Unprotected setMarketingAddress function
findings.description: The setMarketingAddress function is unprotected and can be called by anyone.

findings.title: Unprotected setLotteryAddress function
findings.description: The setLotteryAddress function is unprotected and can be called by anyone, potentially leading to unauthorized changes to the lottery address.

findings.title: Unprotected setNFTAppAddress function
findings.description: The setNFTAppAddress function is unprotected and can be exploited by an attacker to manipulate the NFT App address.

findings.title: Unprotected excludeFromFee function
findings.description: The excludeFromFee function is unprotected and can be exploited by an attacker.

findings.title: Unprotected includeInFee function
findings.description: The includeInFee function is unprotected and can be accessed by anyone.

findings.title: Unprotected setFeeRates function
findings.description: The setFeeRates function can be called by anyone, which may lead to unauthorized changes to fee rates.

findings.title: Unprotected setSwapTokensAtAmount function
findings.description: The setSwapTokensAtAmount function is unprotected and can be exploited by an attacker.

findings.title: Unprotected setMaxTxLimit function
findings.description: The setMaxTxLimit function is unprotected and can be exploited by an attacker to set an arbitrary maximum transaction limit.

findings.title: Unprotected changeSwapStatus function
findings.description: The changeSwapStatus function is unprotected and can be exploited by an attacker.

findings.title: Unprotected changeTradingStatus function
findings.description: The smart contract owner can switch trading status, which may be used to stop users from buying, selling or transferring assets.

findings.title: Unprotected excludeFromReward function
findings.description: The excludeFromReward function is unprotected and can be exploited by an attacker to manipulate rewards.

findings.title: Unprotected includeInReward function
findings.description: The includeInReward function is accessible by external users without any access control, potentially allowing unauthorized manipulation of rewards.
